title: Nursing Practice Competency Enhancement: Universal Design for Learning (UDL)-Based Integration of Students with Disabilities

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language proficiency and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Designing language learning materials tailored to various disability types (visual, auditory, motor, cognitive) by applying UDL’s three principles (Representation, Engagement, Action/Expression)
Developing and applying a checklist to analyze learners’ individual physical and social needs with over 90% accuracy

Learners can conduct a comparative study of experimental and control groups applying three UDL strategies (multimedia materials, flexible assessment methods, structured collaborative learning) over a three-week project-based assessment. They collect data on learning engagement (attendance rate ≥80%, discussion participation ≥5 times) and achievement (exam scores improved by 10%, assignment scores ≥B+) from 20 students with disabilities, and write a 10-page analysis report verifying statistical significance (p-value <0.05) using SPSS.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
